intro: Pacouria paraensis, commonly known as the Brazilian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
